title: 820-4924 no backlight
message:
Hi there,

I have a 820-4924 with no backlight.

I have 50 volts on PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT 

i've tested pretty much all of the backlight circuit and it seems fine. U7700 seems to have everything too.

any ideas where to go next?

thanks

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message:
there was also a small amount fo liquid near C5801 which i notice has a prob point under for EDP_BKLT_PWM but it's present on pin 8 of the LCD connector at 1.5v

the other liquid damage was only on the SSD but i wonder if this could affect anything with backlight?

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message: 50 volts on backlight output means it doesn't see a load or the computer is not seeing the light of the screen. Likely a bad screen, screen cable, or LCD connector Have you tried a known good 2015 13" Retina display? 2013/14 will not work!

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message: Hi John, with the original screen i get 0 volts on backlight output so i swapped to a KG screen and i can see the question mark folder with a light. I tried another screen to be sure and same thing... confused!

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message: If with the kg screen you get 50 volts, I would say bad LCD connector.

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message: Okay thanks - will get to that shortly

title: 820-4924 no backlight
message: Is there any way to tell for sure that it’s the connector - visually it looks great and I’m sure all of the voltages are present. I guess Pin 1 BCK light output being 50v can justify the connector replacement but just want to double check?
